description: lamp +‎ shade. The verb sense comes from the idea of making something more conspicuous by hanging a lampshade on it.

entries.meaning: A cover over a lamp to either diffuse the light or to block it in certain directions to avoid glare in the eyes.

verbs.description: lampshade (third-person singular simple present lampshades, present participle lampshading, simple past and past participle lampshaded)

entries.meaning: (narratology, fandom slang) To intentionally call attention to the improbable, incongruent, or clichéd nature of an element or situation featured in a work of fiction within the work itself.
examples: Only one short bit of humor is endearing, lampshading the ridiculousness of an eye-mask being able to conceal a superhero's identity.

entries.meaning: (fashion) To wear an oversize top with skintight thigh-high boots and no leggings.
To adorn with one or more lampshades.
